Just a black screen, not even a low battery picture when I try to turn it on. I took it to a repair shop today and they tried a new battery and said it was not responding to anything. They said they didn't see any water damage or anything either. Really not satisfied with this as it took me a few months to save up for. Good news, I get a refund for what I paid for it.. So that's appropriate

I'm not that thrilled with this purchase. The battery is expanding, so that the screen has become loose. I suspect that the battery was not new when I received the phone. I will have to replace this phone a lot sooner than I would have if I had bought a new phone from Apple. So, I'm not sure that buying a refurbished phone has really saved me anything in terms of money or electronics waste. There is very little transparency about what parts are used in these refurbished phones, so you're at the mercy of the company that is reselling.

Item came scratched all over front side and on back of phone. Second phone came in an identical state despite being categorized in excellent condition. Phones also came with screen protectors to hide the scratch damage on the front of the phones. Would not recommend at all.
I think it works overall it jus over heats fast- update the battery wouldn't stop dying so I returned it and I've been trying to get refunded for two days now having major issues not happy

reviewTitle: Phone in bad condition instead of a “good” one
reviewDescription: I ordered iphone 12 “in good condition”, but the one i received I would rather treat as bad or “acceptable”, but far not a “good” one:Scratches and deep dents are all over the body and camera, deep scratch is on the screen. Battery is only 82%. I’m so unsatisfied!

From day one it would not hold a charge.  Took it and had the battery tested and was told the battery was good and that whatever was wrong with it was internal and that they couldn’t tell me what it was.  Returned it for a refund.
Don't but it excellent they give you a bad one anyways. Just save the money and get the cheapest one, then when you have enough money just get a new phone.

Phone maintained a charge for 3 months, then died. It was tested at U Break I Fix, the phone refuses to even accept the current required to charge it. ABSOLUTELY ZERO EXPOSURE TO WATER OR MISUSE. Did Jem Jem offer to replace it? Of course not!  Stay away from this seller.

Phone arrived with dead battery. Immediately charged it. Upon turning on the phone there was a message about the battery when clicking on it showed the attached messages about the battery. Wouldn’t go away. Who knows if the battery is bad, or the battery isn’t genuine or if it’s not installed right. It would not show the health of the battery. Couldn’t take a chance to returned it the same day. There were also a couple pictures saved on the phone showing screen shots of the testing of the phone. Phone was not wiped clean ready for new setup.

reviewTitle: I was sent a phone that would not open because it was password protected
reviewDescription: I was sent a phone that would not open because it was password protected,, I hope the next one doesn't have this issue,, not happy,It would be nice if the new order was sent faster to make up for this,,, please!!! Update,, the phone was returned over a week ago still no refund, the new phone order was supposed to be delivered on 3rd, and still has not checked yet, it's not expected until the 10th now

After using it for almost a year the sound of my phone was somehow not good. So i took it to the service center. When they opened it they claimed the battery of the phone was duplicate. That feels cheated that too on amazon website.
Phone will not charge or turn on. It tries to power up but nothing happens past the Apple symbol. Waiting on vendor to see where we go from here.

**UPDATE** after taking the phone to be repaired I was told this is bot the Iphone 12 6.1in, but, the Iphone 12 mini 5.4 I was sent the wrong phone altogether! I spent $322 and wasnt even sent he proper phone.  I am beyond disappointed with this Amazon isn't being helpful at the moment to try and gwt it corrected. I bought this phone 3 months ago and the screen completely failed with the "green screen of death". I have tried factory resetting, manually resetting, and every other fix possible. Phone needs a new screen. This phone is in mint condition kept in an otter box. Never dropped, never exposed to water. Terrible purchase, I do not recommend.

This phone is trash..  Iv never been so disappointed in a purchase in my life..  fist of all the phone shows up with a big crack in the glass back.  I think oh well it’s refurbished and I’m just going to put a case on it so who cares.  Then  I power it up and it was never factory reset.  Everything was in a foreign language.  After sorting this out  I find that my batter life is short.  Very short.  System says it has 87% battery life but my experience says otherwise.  I can get maybe 4 hours out of a complete charge only if I don’t use the phone at  all..  iv seen it drain a whole battery in as little time as an hour.  I am completely disappointed an will be buying a screen for my old iPhone and just using that.  And I guess I’ll just toss this pile of junk in the junk drawer.  Big waist of nearly 300$

Since I’ve purchased this phone, my iMessages come through and I see the notification on my Lock Screen, but when I open the actual message, the message is gone like it never came through. The screen is so sensitive and I’m constantly correcting my typing (itll type doubles when I don’t want doubles), even with the sensitivity setting on the lowest. Now my pictures won’t send through text and I’m not receiving soome of the texts being sent to me. Every now and then while listening to music, the volume will just randomly go lower so I have to restart the app for the volume to go back to normal.This has been so frustrating :(

Purchased the phone for my daughter.  Description says the phone is unlocked.  When Sim card was placed in the phone it says SIM NOT SUPPORTED. Took phone and SIM card to phone carrier as the message says the phone may need to be unlocked or another SIMcard needs to be placed by the carrier.  NOT EVEN THE CARRIER COULD ACCESS THE PHONE.  It was locked! So now I wasted almost $300 and have no phone for my daugther to use.

I used this phone for a short time and the battery is always giving problems! The seller doesn't help, and Amazon doesn’t care either! I paid for a product that barely worked. I asked for a replacement, not a refund, just want a new phone or store credit to buy another. I can’t be without a phone. I’m going to report this to the Better Business Bureau and the Attorney General. Amazon is bad too!Keep your money and shop elsewhere!

I have been a fan of and purchased all of my phones in the last few years as amazon renewed phones. I haven’t chosen premium as I’ve been very happy with the condition of the phones as just renewed. I ordered an iPhone 12 a couple weeks ago and was very happy with it so I ordered a second renewed iPhone 12 that should have been in excellent condition. The phone I received was awful. Opening the box you could tell it had been dropped as the case was dented. Thinking I would give it a chance I got my old phone backup loaded only to find the top half of the screen didn’t work and the display jumped around so much it took me two hours to reset the phone so I could return it. This phone could not have been tested. All my other phones had come from New York area and this one came from California so I’m not sure if there’s a severe quality control problem there as this phone should never have been sent out. Now I’m held up weeks as I return the inoperable phone to get a refund so I can order another.

reviewTitle: Bad Flaw And Impossible To Fix
reviewDescription: So the phone will not reliably connect to the wifi and stay connected.  Went through all the usual ways to fix it, no good.  It just doesn't work.  The link time is around 30% slower for download but upload is the same compared to the old Iphone 11.But nothing can be done to exchange it.  I bought it as a gift for someone in Thailand, paid the extra shipping and importation fees.  After a ridiculously delayed shipping time (about a month), it simply being placed into shipment, this happens right away and now there is nothing can do to exchange.They won't do a general send a new one and send back the old one.  You're on your own for sending it back, and no exchange possible.  Would have to pay and shipping charges over again, wait at least a week before having it recredited, and then take business elsewhere.Yes it was stupid of me to buy international off of here, but they said their 90 Warranty applies and offered it for international order.In reality it's a ripoff and now going to have to pay for a repair.A flaw this obvious really should have beeb caught for a rebuilt phone.  They should never have released this from the factory.  So naturally this can happen with one you buy.For me, a complete ripoff

reviewTitle: Face Recognition died, non-genuine parts, poor battery
reviewDescription: When I first booted it up I got this message:  "Unknown Part - Unable to determine if your iPhone camera is a genuine Apple part. This could be because the part is non-genuine, not functioning as expected, or the installation is incomplete."I was super aggravated but my daughter needed a phone and everything seemed to be working properly.Battery life was pretty weak but she seemed to be dealing well enough. I should have returned it immediately.4 months of decent working condition and now the Face Recognition just stopped working. What a disappointment this Amazon Renewed product has been. 90 Day guarantee... we made it about 120 days but now NO Face Recognition and poor battery performance. I had hoped to get one year out of this phone. I knew it was an older model but I think 1 year on a Renewed product was a more than reasonable expectation.DON'T waste your money on this renewed product.

reviewTitle: Disappointed amazon let privi tech sell me this potato.
reviewDescription: When i bought this photo it said seller was amazon renewed store. Wasn’t true. They then made me go through seller helper bot to customer service to contact refund on behalf of the third party they’re not liable for. Sound didn’t work on the phone hardly at all. Still waiting on it to ship. First phone purchase in 5 years a waste. Beautiful phone came quick setup quick useless for anything but work

reviewTitle: Seller Trying to Rip Me off
reviewDescription: This phone arrived defective. I could not set it up because it kept turning off even though it was fully charged. I initiated a refund as it was suppose to be covered under Amazons seller-renewed program. this is the response I got from the seller,Hello,  At this time, we have initiated a $1 refund towards your return since the device was received damaged and as you may know, customer damage devices are not covered by Amazons seller-renewed program. Unfortunately, we can't accept this return back for a full refund as it has voided the warranty but, we can offer one of two options.  1. Refund the order with a 20% restocking fee 2. Return the device back with no further resolution In the event, that we do not hear back we will proceed to return the device back to the address we have on file.I did not damage the phone, I returned it in its originally packing. If it was damaged it already had been and it didn’t work. They want to charge me 20% restocking fee for a defective and supposedly now damaged phone?? I think this seller is trying to make money on defective phones!! DO NO BUY. Update: They keep insisting that I damaged it and that they are returning  the phone to me and issue no refund. This seller should be shut down.

The device was good except bettery. The battery health is only 80. I personally expect atleast 90 or higher It's dissapoint me and there was a Little scratch on the edge of the screen.otherwise everything is in good condition.

Purchased from this listing 2 different times, from two different sellers. Both times, the item was shipped through Amazon and sold by a seller with a 95% or higher positive rating in the last year. In both instances, I purchased a refurbished, unlocked iPhone 12 with 256g storage that was listed as "Excellent" condition.Unfortunately in both instances, the phone's battery health was less than 80% (the listing guarantees battery health of 80% or higher). One was 77% and one was 79%. I read reviews of people getting above 80% so I returned the first one, which was 79%, and paid a higher price for the second one--the 77% one! Otherwise, the devices both seemed to be in great condition.
Did not receive for over a week after ordering. Seems to overheat quite easily.

This iphone was inexpensive and therefore still probably worth the money. The reviews I read warned me about the potential poor battery life and call quality. Unfortunately, I am experiencing both. The battery reads at a maximum capacity of 90%, however, when streaming music or downloading apps, the battery life is dramatically low. As far as the call quality, unfortunately, all calls must be taken with earbuds or kept on speakerphone. Seeing as I own earbuds and often take calls on speaker phone in my home this is not a huge deal breaker but definitely not ideal.
64gb I'm this day and age us useless.  128gb should be minimum

This was a refurbish phone, the unit was ok but no more than that the battery total life was at 80% which is on the low side I also had some issues with the charging system I wish I would have returned it.

Has a tiny scratch on the screen and came dirty with some glue? or sticky substance near the buttons. other than that the phone is great and is functioning properly. i was skeptical but i do not regret it! 🙂

I bought a refurbished cell phone - excellent, with the promise that the minimum battery would be 80% but when I check the cell phone I find that it is at 79%, some of us hope that it will be more than 80% but I didn't think it would be less than the promise. For this, maybe I would have bought a reconditioned-good one and it was cheaper. The screen is fine but the corners and back of the phone have light scratches. What disappointed me was the battery.

reviewTitle: Battery is not so good and there is a some crack on back
reviewDescription: The batter is %78 and there is a crack on back.
0 stars becuase its a crApple Phone, nothing special here.The 3 stars is for the seller who had it delivered to me extremely fast.It would have been 5 stars, but it is a crApple phone

reviewTitle: Defective Iphone. Seller has a different return policy than Amazon.  Charged restocking fee!
reviewDescription: Stay away from this seller!!!  I ordered an Iphone 12 from them and it did not work.  The sim card was not recognized by the phone.  I called me carrier and they could not get it to work.  I took it directly to a local carrier location and they tried 2 new sim cards and also the e-sim that is in phone and nothing.  Took the phone to the Apple store and they would not service it because it was from a 3rd party seller.  Called my carrier again and they connected me to their Apple tech support and nothing.  Amazon gave me a 90 day window to return the phone.  The seller has a different return window of 30 days.  I returned the phone and they charged me a restocking fee.  I've purchased many cell phones from Amazon sellers and had to return a few over the years.  I was never charged a restocking fee by any of them.  Stay away from this seller.  There are plenty of good ones out there to do business with.

reviewTitle: Bueno? Para nada, no lo compres.
reviewDescription: Necesitaba un celular y decidí comprar este por los buenos comentarios y fue la peor decisión desde que lo recibí se sentía caliente, prendió una sola vez y se apagó el solo pensé que era Por la carga lo puse a cargar y nunca mas me encendió a sido la peor experiencia que he tenido con un producto recomiendo que no lo compres

The phone wasn’t holding its charge, overheating and  the bottom of the phone was swollen at the edges, took it to a repair shop to check it out, technician informed me that this phone had water damage and the battery was swollen, replaced the battery and it’s still not holding its charge and overheating, not sure about the quality of “Amazon Certified”

reviewTitle: Became relooked after going to Europe
reviewDescription: This phone was great until we used a European SIM card. After hours on the phone with Anazon and Apple, (we originally reached out to this seller) we found out that it was relocked and went back to its original carrier, which was  Straight Talk. So unless we bought Straight Talk Service it was unusable. We didn’t want a new carrier so the phone is useless.. Since this happened after the 90 day guarantee this company wouldn’t help us. Amazon finally gave us $100 but we were out a phone for two weeks before it was resolved. So beware if you travel, Amazon and this seller do not honor Anazon  verified, refurbished and fully unlocked.

reviewTitle: Don’t do it! Buy at your own risk!
reviewDescription: Phone is trash . It could not call or text eith SIM card. It said dos and network unavailable. I googled reason for this and it said likely used in scam, reported as stolen and then sold to some poor person . This was a present for my son. He was so sad when I took it back to return it. This phone was a complete waste of time, money, and energy. I hope they refund all my money because they day they don’t have to

I bought this phone as a Christmas gift for my daughter. It worked for five months and randomly shut off, and directed me to connect it to my MacBook and restore it. I attempted the restoration multiple times. It failed each time, showing “Error 2015.” According to the information I’ve found on the internet, that error indicates a hardware failure issue. I paid $400 for this phone all for it to no work after a few months. THIS IS A HUGE SCAM! DO NOT BUY!

i would not recommend this purchase. the battery of this phone is very poor. fully charged in the morning and dying by noon. i dropped this phone (with a case on) and few times over the span over 2 months and now it is completely unresponsive and the screen has green lines on it. seller didn't respond either.

I purchased 2 phones one phone I was able to switch the service within 5 minutes and the other phone when I tried to switch service stated that " Whoops This phone has been reported lost or stolen please contact merchant for further assistance" would not connect phone is in route for refund will comment after returned...

I got the black iPhone 12 in "excellent" condition. Within 1 day of receiving and setting up the phone, it wouldn't stop freezing up. The screen wouldn't register when I would touch it, and if it was in the middle of something it would just stop. All I could do was turn it off and wait for it to unfreeze which could take up to an hour at times. After a few days I traded it in for a new phone at Verizon.

reviewTitle: Not very happy with my purchase after problems arising 3 months prior to purchase.
reviewDescription: I ordered this iPhone because I saw that it was a good deal and I believed would be a good alternative to spending hundreds on dollars on a new one. I was WRONG. It’s seems  to be glitchy and the camera lense stoped focusing 3 MONTHS after using it. I called around and was suggested to just order a brand new iPhone instead of buying another one off of Amazon or Walmart. Again so upset in the decision. DONT RECOMMEND!

The phone has on the setting icon a red number beside it. It's because they must have replaced the screen with an after market screen. The iPhone said it didn't recognize the screen. My wife uses it. She wanted a 5g phone so we bought this to replace an XR we bought refurbished and she has never had any problems with it. Then the battery on this 12 ran down quickly. Didn't hold a charge very long at all. When we received it showed around 83% health. But it wasn't very healthy. So we spent $100 to get a new battery. I knew I would have to replace it sooner or later, I just thought it would be later. The sensitive touch is not all that responsive. Not nearly what the iPhone XR has. I use it now. I haven't sent it back but I can't give the phone over a 2. Still trying it out but don't think it's going to smooth out by itself. I have bought a number of refurbished items from Amazon. This is really the first one with problems.  New addition to original Post. OTHER problems. The only way we can hear incoming calls is through speaker. Never through  built in speaker. Returning. I would take an exchange but only refund was offered

Refurbished-backed and supported by Amazon, reviews of Amazon renewed products highly positive. Bought iPhone 12 renewed, received and appeared in excellent condition. Transferred info from my phone, working well except on day 1, after completing a call, screen went black, completely unresponsive to all attempts of changing (unable to turn on, off, or get anything else). But, only lasted 1-2 minutes and suddenly came on.Day 4 same black screen occurred after a call, but not resolving. Just sent old phone in as trade-in, obviously unable to call customer svc, went to online chat on my computer, not an easy task but typing all symptoms then waiting for responses, 1st with assistant, then transferred to someone, repeating some of conversation, transferred to someone else;  all close to 2 hrs just explaining my issue.  During the end of this, the phone suddenly came on, after 4+ hrs of black screen.  Have not tried calling anyone but using text and internet options. If happens again, I could lose all phone data - contacts, photos, subscriptions, invoices, - so much we have on there!My options, per emails with customer service, were to contact seller and see what was proposed but no automatic replacement. Main recommendation was to return phone to Amazon and refund expected usually about 30 days, maybe more.I have already sent in my old phone.  Before returning this new phone I need to purchase another so I can hopefully still get data transferred.  So much for a safe inexpensive option of buying renewed.  Will have to spend another several hundred bucks for yet another phone, hoping this damaged one will last long enough to transfer data, And what does that mean as to my trade in?  Still don’t have all answers from customer svc.This has not been a great experience, especially since I don’t have a phone I can trust to make any calls, and don’t know what the issue is so am nervous I may lose all data in the phone at any point.In Limbo and very disappointed

reviewTitle: Great cosmetic condition but cameras would not focus.
reviewDescription: Would’ve given this transaction a four star if the cameras would’ve worked properly!  Cell phone basically looked brand new with very minor cosmetic flaws that were even hard to see. Battery appeared to last one full day and phone would get warm on the back which may be normal for this model of phone?. I had no problems with the phone on my Verizon account once I inserted the Sim card from my old phone. Was disappointed that the cameras would not work due to not being able to focus which made some of my online accounts useless. I am returning the phone and I will update this review once I see how the seller handles my refund.

Under features and details, the listing stated “inspected and guaranteed to have minimal cosmetic damage, which is not noticeable when the device is held at arm’s length”I consider the scratches and chip in the glass to be noticeable when held at arms length.  And the tempered glass cover I got for it doesn’t seal around the chips.  I could have returned it, but was a little impatient due to personal need of a “new to me” phone.  That being said, I don’t think I should have been in the position to settle for the screen with three total NOTICEABLE chips/scratches because this phone passed their inspection.-The battery is at 82%It was unlocked and was surprisingly painless to get set up with my carrier.It’s too soon to tell if I will be happy with the purchase, but it IS better than the iPhone 7 I had to upgrade from.

I bought this phone expecting it to be refurbished but upon arrival, I noticed scratches on the side of the screen. After using it for a day I was wondering why the battery was dying so fast, I looked at the battery health in the settings and it was 70% and it said that I would have to get the battery replaced soon. On the title of the product, it said that the phone was in acceptable condition but it never specified what exactly was wrong with it. I just was under the impression that buying a refurbished phone would mean that it would be good quality.

This phone has issues: Battery, WiFi, touching screen, Radiation, Getting overheated, jumping, freezes. Always saying I need space and network problems.It jumps around. Times I can’t see my family members on Tracker.Research this phone and man. It’s really 😫😡. I miss my 8plus.Likes:  clearer FaceTime. Some apps work good.Siri can hear.Don’t buy a 12, So the research!

Product arrived and was packaged okay, but did not behave as expected. When connected to a charging device the phone would erratically open and close apps as if the device was being touched repeatedly. Would not recommend. I would advise the seller to do Quality checks on this before putting it up for sale.

I ended up returning this phone. I purchased it under the "Renewed Premium" standard, so I thought it would be fine. The battery capacity was at 89%, and when I turned on the phone there was a big warning that the display was not an Apple part. Within a few hours of turning the phone on, there was a big line that went across the entire screen. Overall, it did not meet my expectations, and I would rather buy with something certified like Best Buy.

You kinda get what you pay for with these things. When I received the product there were slight marks on the back lens and the right side of my screen needed extra pressure to click. Thinking this was due to my screen protector I saw no wrong until I took it off months later to see that actually the screen itself seemed to be replaced and wasn't installed properly. Other than that it's a decent phone, the battery deteriorates very fast as time goes on! but again you get what you pay for! I would suggest just buying a brand-new phone.  6 months post- it doesn't hold battery!

reviewTitle: Screen had scratch but was supposed to be in Excellent condition.
reviewDescription: The phone was in excellent shape except for a nick in the center of the screen, a circular scratch about 2mm in diameter and noticeable at arms length. Since this was for my daughter, who was at camp for two weeks, and I did not want to spend time sending it back and purchased a screen protector anyway. Recommend checking as soon as you get it, if this stuff matters to you.

I was so skeptical about purchasing a used iPhone online i purchased it for my 10 year old daughter because her iPhone 11 stopped working and i needed her to have a phone for emergencies, this iPhone came in perfect condition small scratches that’s hardly noticeable it came with a screen protector and charger adapter and cord and instructions for set up that was so easy we didn’t have to go in store to T-Mobile to switch anything we was able to take her SIM card out of old phone and put it into this iPhone 12 I’m very satisfied with this purchase and my daughter is happy with the upgrade from a iPhone 11 to a 12  I would definitely purchase with this vendor again  if you have doubts don’t take a chance you will be happy that you did
My son liked the iPhone very much he needed the phone so he could keep in contact with us.

reviewTitle: I was nervous, but pleasantly surprised!
reviewDescription: I have been looking into purchasing a refurbished phone for a bit now, and was originally going to buy from backmarket.com but found an article listing out the best places to buy refurbished from. #1 on the list is of course, direct from apple, but also most expensive. The next on the list was Amazon renewed. I gave it a shot, and also saw that the specific seller of the 12 I received had pretty good ratings as well.I received the new device on the day it was expected and the phone is truly in excellent condition. No dents or deep scratches, no evidence of after market parts, battery health at exactly 85%, a scuff on the back of the phone only noticeable in the right lighting, and no visible scratches on the screen itself with a screen protector. There are light scratches on the screen of the phone, but again not visible with a glass screen cover.Overall I am extremely pleased, I realized the possibility of the occasional lemon amongst all the good experiences, but based off this purchase, I would buy from Amazon renewed again!I went from an XR (that was on the fritz!) to a 12 for less than $300. I’m happy! I will note I purchased one in “excellent” condition.
Like new condition. Exceeded my expectations as a first time used-phone buyer.

reviewTitle: A very good product, so far so good.
reviewDescription: For the price its in very good shape. No regrets.
Buena Calidad, No Rasguños, o Golpes llego en excelentes condiciones
accurate description and fast shipping, I highly recommend this seller
No issue with the iphone 12. Would buy again.
What I've expected!  No problems thus far! My grandson, loves it and that's all that mattered.
¡Llegó en perfectas condiciones! ¡Muy buen equipo! Es un teléfono realmente hermoso, me encantó el color. Llegó a tiempo y todo en perfecto e stado.

I picked the most expensive option for an “excellent” condition refurbished iPhone 12. Phone arrived with no padding at all. It was bouncing around inside a small box which was bouncing around in a huge box, which had been crushed in on one side. Saw no apparent damage, and the exterior was clean without scratches, but the battery health was only 85%. According to Apple, that means it would be good for 2-3 months of normal use before it would drop to 80%, at which point they tecommend a battery replacement. Ludicrous.

When I first turned the phone on it said it was using a generic phone screen and not apple which at first I thought was fine. But as I started using the phone I realized that the touchscreen didn’t always work.As well the battery is constantly overheats preventing it from being allowed to charge.Disappointed.

reviewTitle: Poor battery life; replacement never came
reviewDescription: Condition was great, but poor battery charge. Ordered a replacement, was “lost in transit.” I called to ensure replacement was canceled so I wouldn’t be charged for not returning the original… sure enough still was charged for a replacement that was never delivered and now I’m fighting to get a response and my $344 back.

I received my phone in an undamaged package, opened the package, and saw my new phone had a chip/crack on the bottom left corner of the screen. This was very disappointing. Everything else appears to be fine and the crack is small… I need the phone for work so I will be living with it.

reviewTitle: More wear and tear than expected
reviewDescription: "Excellent refurbished phone" several scratches, chiped on corners, screen has discoloration.
When we received the phone the screen was popping up just a tad in the bottom left corner, luckily we knew what to look for and sure enough two screws were missing on the inside.

reviewTitle: Developed Ghost Touch issue after 5 months
reviewDescription: Product was refurbished but has hardware defect that allows ghost touches on the screen. The phone has become unusable. We have gone through all of the troubleshooting steps and fixes and nothing is working.

Got an iPhone 12, unlocked and refurbished, paid for the Excellent option. It came a day later from its original promised date, which I don’t mind that much, but its condition was fair at its best! I know it’s a pre owned phone, but if the excellent option comes like this, imagine the good or fair one! The phone was intended as a gift for a cousin from Europe, who is leaving today, otherwise would’ve returned it.Ps, the phone I’m sure it will operate fine.

I order the like new condition and got a good condition phone instead every port was filthy I had to take it myself to a pro to clean it deeply other than that the phone worked well just disappointed I didn’t get what I paid for but aye you live in you learn 🤷🏽‍♂️ Not mention my mute button was so stiff to turn on and off 🤦🏽‍♂️Buy at your own risk I guess some people on here get what they actually paid for
I paid extra to get the “excellent” quality phone. It said the battery health would be at least 85-90%…It’s at 80% health…so now I have a battery issue. Buyer beware

reviewTitle: message of camera defective battery is not maintaining a charge
reviewDescription: After receiving iPhone 12.Packaging was decent, charged the item to 100% notice that battery was not lasting for a whole day needed to charge it twice in a day while not even using it.As well as receiving a defective camera message from iPhone diagnostics

reviewTitle: La cámara fue reparada con una pieza no original.
reviewDescription: La cámara original fue reemplazada por una pieza no original y ahora recibimos una alerta que dice exactamente eso: que la cámara original fue reemplazada por una pieza no original.
Was a refurbished phone. After setting up I realized the pull down control panel does not pull down. I contacted seller and they have approved a return.
Speaker sensor broke after 1.5 years and cost to repair is $270.  Apparently a known issue with iPhone 12.  Otherwise has worked well.

reviewTitle: "good"  condition here is more like " fair " condition
reviewDescription: there is dents and scratch around the frame, as well as the screen, back glasses is fine but yeah it works, 83 % battery health

Purchased an "Excellent Renewed" and it came and looked good on the outside. Tried to set up and it started fine, back plate started to get really warm and it would power cycle continually every 2-5 minutes. Assuming the glass was replaced and it was just checked to see if it would power on but not checked for any length of time. Had to return and now have to wait for refund.

reviewTitle: Si funciona pero no le dura la batería
reviewDescription: El teléfono se ve bien y en buenas condiciones, pero la batería no le duró casi nada aunque esté apagado, me decepcionó mucho
Se supone que tiene una excelente condición y está muy rayado, muy maltratado, la batería está al 91% pero físicamente está muy maltratado.

reviewTitle: Front Camera stuck in un-focused mode
reviewDescription: Everything seemed to work great EXCEPT for the back camera, which was stuck in a fixed focus mode. So, unless the object is right in front of the camera, the picture will come out blurry. I researched fixes and it sounds like a physical deformity of the phone.It’s unfortunate, but the camera is very important for my usage, so I will be returning this.
Phone hangs too much and I believe this is not a high quality refurbished product

I have had this phone for nearly 3 months and think I should return it asap.  On the surface it is as good as new. As reported there was a minor surface scar.  I have used the tech support site to remedy issues.  But I don’t speak the language of tech.  Three functional problems persist: intermittently the screen freezes, including the  pass code screen; “call failed”, the only remedy is shutting the phone down and restart it. (phone set on both data and wifi); the touch screen is frequently insensitive to touch, more often at the upper right periphery of the screen (Are my fingers too cold?). So, these intermittent problems are the reasons I would not purchase again.  Can I expect an Apple to service this phone?  UPDATE: returned the phone within warranty period.  Refund was completed asap!  Happy!

reviewTitle: GOOD PURCHASE IF YOUR NEEDING SOMETHING IMMEDIATELY!
reviewDescription: When the phone came, it was in good condition. I’ve had my phone for 2 days, and I’m already noticing glitching while maneuvering around the screen. Also, my battery percentage is shot. Phone went from 40 to 11 within a 20 minute period. Thank goodness this is for temporary use. If not excellent condition, DONT GET THIS PHONE.
Phone camera is broken in the inside and charger isn’t functioning properly
The iphone is pealing off and had issuies reading the sim card.

reviewTitle: Was okay til I tried to take a picture
reviewDescription: The camera is broken in this phone. Does not focus. Very blurry.

It came and half the screen didn't work, it wouldn't respond to anything, this slowly started getting worse and over the course of 2 days it completely stopped responding. Very disappointed. I hope to switch it out for one that works so I can leave 5 stars because I wad really looking forward to this new phone.

Everything was great at first. Then 3 weeks after having this phone, I started to notice it would go mute on its on like when I’m watching a video, or listening to music. It also freezes up, and starts glitching! Please pay attention to the comments before Purchasing anything, especially as expensive as this phone was.

I was super excited about this new phone. My friends convinced me to convert from Android to iPhone. It arrived quickly & looked great. I am not good with tech items, so I took it to my AT&T store for help. They were happy to help, turned it on only to discover it's locked to T-mobile, which means I can't use it as an At&T costumer. In the description this phone clearly states it's an AT&T phone, such a terrible lie. Only thing I am happy about, is that it's returnable.

Everything started out nice the phone appears to be in good condition and work fine it only will work for one week. The phone powered off as if it was dead I charged the phone it came on as if it was going to start up and went right back off

Unlike the most of the reviewers here, the phone I got showed lots of evidence of its previous owner and no evidence of being refurbished. The phone arrived with scratches deep into the metal and what looked like a circular image burned into the upper half of the screen, centered, about the size of a quarter.  The screen had a greenish tint, and I couldn't get passed the language selection part of setup.  Anyway, it turned out it had some version of iOS on it that was neither factory nor up to date.  You'd think any of these issues would have been noticed by a human being before me, right?  But anyway, I did manage to get the phone updated with itunes and a computer, and it managed to boot up.  The camera is blurry and bright, the backlight is only randomly functional, and it's all so very green looking.  As of writing this, I have ordered the replacement, so please take this with the grain of salt that I may end up being in the group of satisfied customers in a week or so.  However, just be aware that the first phone you get may be a brick.
The battery is good the phone works as expected the phone itself has no scratches I bought the cheapest option and it’s like new ! Love it!

Purchased from Chubbietech in NJ.  Phone described as "excellent."  No visible flaws.  Can be set up quickly, if you know all your passwords (I didn't and was running around looking for them).  Apple care and AT&T were worse than useless in helping me set up the phone.  Even provided wrong information.  When I gave up on receiving assistance, I was able to set it up by myself (though I am totally not knowledgeable about these things).  Phone battery charges to 100%.  This is my first iPhone.  Up to now I have used a Jitterbug phone and will keep that phone for the services it provides.  I obtained the iPhone in order to have fall protection with an Apple Watch (which I also purchased).

reviewTitle: Phone in excellent condition. Battery health 95%.
reviewDescription: Phone in excellent condition. Battery health 95%. I like that iPhone 12 screen does not have any curved edge so my glass screen protector goes on flawlessly and does start separating at the edge over time. Great camera over prior models. Just a note that home button is replaced by a virtual whit bar at bottom. Easy transition to get used to. Also the phone power turn off is a little different since home button is gone and takes a little to remember the buttons to press to activate.

I was scared of getting this but everything was brand new like. I got it in excellent condition. The speaker and camera works great also. All I had to do was take my sim out of my old phone and put it in the new phone! Super easy definitely recommend
My sister's Iphone 8 plus stopped working,  so I bought this as a replacement.  I was leary about buying "renewed," but it works great.
Easy to move data from my old phone to this new I Phone 12.  Excellent condition for a renewed phone. No scratches or defects!  I could charge to 100%.  Very pleased with this purchase.

Been having since April 2024. Make sure you are home when this item comes or you’ll be waiting the next day or racing to the office to pick it up yourself. It was packaged well. No scratches. A little nitch on the sides where the black is, but nothing I bc would go crazy behind. Screen was fine and so is the speaker. My battery Percent was at 88 no big deal to me if I have to replace it later I will.

Was hesitant about purchasing an unlocked refurbished phone online. Pleasantly surprised! Came with a screen saver already on, was very easy to activate with my provider.You would never know it was refurbished. Would definitely recommend 👍🏼
I just received the phone and it’s beautiful!! Not a scratch or anything. It works wonderfully and my boyfriend is beyond happy! Thank you!
I purchased a good conditioned phone but received a like new phone. It has zero scratches or any signs of use. I'm happy.

I was happy with the overall condition of the phone.  It charged to 100% and the body of the phone was in great condition.  However, the battery life is extremely short, approximately 12 hours.  I am used to my iphone XR battery only needing to be charged once a day so was expecting something similar with this phone.  If you don't need a phone to keep a charge more than 12 hours this would be a great buy.  Not sure I will keep this particular phone.

Everything about the phone is straight, there’s no issue but unfortunately the phone does get hot, really fast. The phone battery life was also 80% which is fine i guess. I can always buy another battery. No scratches on the phone so that’s a plus!

Everything about it works so well unfortunately after taking my first call without a Bluetooth device connected I realize the front ear speaker is completely unresponsive. No sound comes out at all. Pretty disappointing. It also was really dirty in that speaker.

Renewed “Excellent” is supposed to be free of defects at an arm’s length. I can see scratches on the screen from further than that.  Also, the battery health for “Excellent” should be better than 86%. I was expecting in the 90s.

reviewTitle: Microphone does not work unless you put it on speaker.
reviewDescription: The microphone does not work unless you put it on speaker.
I like this phone a lot but the battery has never been able to charge over 85%. This is for the Excellent condition. Would have returned it but couldn’t wait for the turn around time.

Condition of the phone was good, performance= normal, size =a bit smaller than what i had. Value could be a bit less its a 12 model . My only gripe is that it took almost 2 weeks to get delivered,  i have prime shipping withing 2 days, so i was very upset that i have prime shipping but had to wait 2 weeks to get my phone. It was a delay after delay. Delievery was terrible
El dispositivo llegó repintado de los laterales como se puede ver en las fotos , y los pequeños golpes que trae igual pintado de muy mala manera

reviewTitle: Good phone however headphone does not work
reviewDescription: Everything on the phone was fine and looked brand new. I've bought refurbished Iphones from Amazon before and have been terrific. However the earpiece to hear someone talk on the phone does not work on this phone. This was bought as a gift for my dad overseas and he told me he needs use the speakerphone in order to use it.

Would have given a 5 if the battery hadn't been below the 80% guaranteed in listing.  The phone's physical appearance is as new.  Beautiful, like new .  Will get the battery replaced and I'll have a new phone.  Tried contacting seller but no response at this time.  Will update review if battery replacement assistance is given.

reviewTitle: Love the phone EXCEPT: Speakers were blown out
reviewDescription: Sadly, chalk up my first experience with buying a used iPhone.  Loved the phone when it arrived.  Condition was good, screen clear.  I was upgrading from an iPhone 8 so you can imagine the delight as I discovered all the new features, the ease of use, and I really loved the mini size.  On the first phone call I made I was surprised at the distorted, gravely sound.  I struggled to hear the caller.  Maximum volume did not improve it.  I tried other calls with different people, same result.  I then tried playing music. The distorted sound was familiar, the sound you get when your old car speakers have been played too loud too long.  I attempted troubleshooting with apple service.  They analyzed the phone (however they do that online) and said it was fine. So, I requested a return.  The Lesson? Don’t break your heart by buying used, and while you’re at it, just get the latest model.
Power button was broken. Had to send back.

The description listed this I Phone would be in excellent condition. It is not in excellent condition. There is a 1/4 scratch/ indentation on the screen and bezel in the upper right corner of this phone. I would rate this phone as average. The battery health was barely above the threshold of 80%. How is that excellent condition? The phone did seem to work as normal. The speaker quality was not 100% clear either. Returning this I Phone. The search continues.
My phone will only stay charge at most 3-4 hours , I feel like I wasted my $300 and should have just bought a new phone. Would not recommend purchasing refurbish phone

I bought four of these iPhones from the seller and after just one year two of them no longer hold a charge.This is the last time I buy a refurbished phone from someone. Wasn’t worth it at all for how much money it cost.
Had to update the software at the Apple Store and the battery life is not great. Next update I will be getting my iPhone directly from Apple.

It arrived two weeks ago, everything in good condition, battery at 82% but from one moment to another the screen stopped working and right now I am in another country at this time for vacations and I had to repair it because I have all my information there ...they told me that the screen was not the best, they used the lowest quality one and the pure repair cost me 150 dollars.

Be careful ordering this phone. Mine was supposed to be “like new” but as soon as I turned my phone on it said there wasn’t a genuine camera bc the camera had been replaced. I can’t even use my back camera bc it looks distorted.

reviewTitle: Arrived fast but Face ID isn't working
reviewDescription: The phone arrived quickly. It's an iPhone 12 Renewed. It has small scratches on the bezel but that's ok. the problem is that the Face ID isn't working. I am contacting the seller to see how this can be resolved, will update this review.
Im trying to charge the phone but it won’t charge. Not sure what wrong with it. It’s maybe just the charger or something else

The item was recieved in good condition, however the screen went out and randomly stops working/randomly taps things after 5 months.  Honestly, this has been my experiance with alot of used tech, just don't go for it, buy something cheap and new

reviewTitle: The phone call quality was bad
reviewDescription: The phone itself was not bad and it worked. Getting connected to my carrier was super easy. The only reason why I’m returning was the sound quality was so bad during the phone calls that I could not hear the other person.

The phone works fine. But the battery lasts too short (half day) and I have to plug in the charger when I get to the office and home. It dies quickly when the power percentage is less than 20%. It dies immediately when 2%. My last phone can run up to 10% mins when 2% battery left.  Note the battery health shows 100%.

Phone worked for 7 months then started having battery issues took it to a repair shop and they showed us that it had lots of very old water damage internal. The phone has never touched water in our possession.

The phone arrived quickly and looked great. 4 months later it is getting warm to the touch even when not in use… short battery life and a constantly dimming screen.. i believe the battery is going bad… i thought i had found a great substitute from buying new but i guess not… and unfortunately it looks like i cannot return it.

reviewTitle: Was in Chinese and pictures where taken
reviewDescription: The phone was accessed and was put in Chinese, also didn’t have a charger box, just a cable with a cnote end so it was a week before I was able to find a compatible charger box to use the phone

reviewTitle: Speaker stopped working and Screen stops working
reviewDescription: Had iphone 12 for 5 months. Seems like screen was replaced with an aftermarket one. Ear speaker stopped working and phone randomly stops responding to input. Im outside of 90 day warranty I have a brick.

reviewTitle: Excellent Condition? Not even Acceptable in my opinion......
reviewDescription: Where to Begin? I ordered an "Excellent" Condition iPhone 12 128gb in blue to replace a lost phone at work. Needed something to use, so I wanted something inexpensive, and good. I landed on an iPhone 12 due to the good reviews left on it. However, my first experience with this type of "Renewed/Refurbished" service, was less than adequate.Cosmetics: Scratches. Advertises can't see nicks or scratches past 12 inches, but I can see it in a dark room (where it's hard to see scratches to begin with) from over 2 feet away! The screen was full on scratched up underneath a screen protector (which was provided), the sides were full of nicks, and somehow, there's a big white scratch on the back glass of the phone (which is notorious for not being able to be scratched.Outside Cleanliness: The charge port came with dust in it, not letting me charge it. Ontop of that, the speakers sound muffled, leading me to believe there's dust INSIDE the phone. It also came wrapped with multiple fingerprints all over the screen.Battery: Not gonna lie, I got nothing bad on the battery. It came with 87% which is decent and advertised.Overall, yes, I did submit a request for it to be replaced. Although it is fully functional, the speakers and charge port are still dirty, and I heard my mic is also muffled. The scratches and Nicks are something to be tolerable with seeing as how it was pre-owned.I will Update when I get my Replacement

The phone was not fully charged and the back near the camera was slightly peeled off and there was no IPhone case.Although refurbished, it would be nice if the description should be clear on the condition of the phone.Trying to charge it now and hope that there is no battery issues.

We purchased a phone for my daughter which worked fine for the first few months. Then, we found out that my daughter had cracked it on accident and we brought it to a shop to get it fixed. My daughter had complained of the battery but our time frame had expired so we could not reach out to this vendor. We mentioned this issue as well to the shop we brought the phone to fix the crack. They let us know that the battery the phone came with was defective and that there were glass pieces left from previous repairs. This has left a bad experience for us as we basically had to invest what we paid for the phone to get it repairs. Ended spending more and the phone did not last a year. Had the phone not cracked and we brought it in for that we would have never known. I do not believe I will be repurchasing from this vendor again.

reviewTitle: Excellent an amazing cute phone but..,
reviewDescription: I really loved this phone when I opened it, everyone else’s “brand new” phone came in an Amazon renewed box and mine just came in a rando weird box that’s blue and grey :/ I loved the phone but when I set it up and went to the battery health it was at 81%. It’s not like I can get a new phone but it said it was inspected by professionals and if it was it wouldn’t be at 81% battery health I’ve only had it for a week and it’s already at 80%. I really hate the fact that the battery try percentage was that and when it goes to 80% guess what YOU HAVE TO CHANGE IT!! and I can’t do that

I purchased recently. I know it is a refurbished phone but I am not impressed with the condition of the phone especially when I selected excellent condition. Additionally, after setting up the phone it seems like the apps are unable to download from the app store.

DO NOT BUY FROM THIS COMPANY, GO ELSEWHEREI barely use this phone as it's my work phone, all in all i probably use it 34-36 hours a week. The battery started to die quickly on me, I contact apple support and they let me know the batter needs service, I was shy a 2 weeks out of my return window and this company denied my request.I don't usually write reviews but if your looking for a decent phone to use, don't order from here as they sold me a phone with a messed up battery, I barely use this phone as is and it needs service.
This product is good the only thing is that It came with alot of screen cracks and tye phone had 2 dents
Phone in good condition besides the battery. The screen has no scratches on it, but the battery health is at 81%.

Did not like words used to describe the in accuracy of wat arrived for the commerce tendered I also did not like the words used in conversations  involved with individual retaining the retention of thus commerce arrival process was elongated
Two corners of the iPhone were damaged. How do they advertise such items as in “the excellent condition?”

I don’t know what it is with this phone a sensitivity issue with the screen or a glitch? It dials people randomly while in a pocket or purse while not actually  using it. Very annoying . Battery sucks too.

bought this phone for my younger brother who’s about to go to the 7th grade. i was a little hesitant to get it bc of some other reviews but it came mostly fine.it just had two dents in the aluminum sides (disappointing of course but they were small enough to not be dealbreakers) and a scuffed backside. all of this could be covered with a case so we just kept it for now. battery health was at 85% which isn’t too great but above the 80% promised. everything else works fine. all in all you might not be getting a phone that looks brand new but its definitely worth it if you’re just looking for something temporary. also for $390 it’s a steal—Apple sells them for like $600.EDIT 7/9: so we gave the phone to my brother on his birthday and he hasn’t even used it for six days before one side of the phone screen began peeling off. like PEELING OFF the corners (almost like a screen protector except it’s the actual screen?? changed from 4 stars to 2.
el celular traia varios golpes, en las esquinas, no entiendo por que te dan un producto asi, la bateria tan solo el 85%, no estoy muy feliz por eso, no era solo un rayon, conte como 6 rayones

Pedí un IPhone 12 con el vendedor ELECTRONIC DEALS en condición “excelente” el cual llegó con un 83% de condición de batería, luego de usarlo unos días su condición a bajado 1% cada 4 días, actualmente se encuentra en 79%. No vivo en los Estados Unidos así que ni siquiera vale la pena devolverlo porque el envío corre por mi cuenta según su política de devolución y es caro. La estética está muy bien a excepción de unos pequeños arañazos sin embargo estoy totalmente insatisfecho.

Not good nothing like what i expected! Phone has a bunch of scratches around the border and definitely not reading my sim. I don’t know if they put the wrong sim holder but every time I insert my chip it says no sim! Not recommended! First time ordering a phone from here an I’m not satisfied

I really liked this phone, even though it was just a small upgrade going from Iphone 11 to 12. It worked fine on my Tmobile account for about one month. The "5G" was never fast, and while at work in my office I would have almost no internet connection through cellular data, even though I am on the unlimited max plan. Then recently, the phone stopped recognizing my sim card. I reset the phone, cleaned my sim card, then even physically went to a TMOBILE store and had them make and activate a brand new sim card for me. This worked for about one hour before the phone stopped reading the sim again and only allowed me to make SOS calls.Needless to say, during this entire ordeal where I called T-mobile multiple times thinking it was a sim card error that lasted 2 days (before I gave up hope and got another phone), I missed several important texts and calls. I then asked for a replacement from Amazon, since that's who I bought it from, but it turns out they are not the company the refurbishes and sells these phones as they claim on the listing, its actually some third party "tek" company. I will not get a replacement as I wanted and instead am still waiting on my refund. So I hope this helps the next person, DO NOT buy used Iphones from Amazon

Bought this phone advertised as excellent condition only to receive a phone with 82% battery capacity, scratches to the camera, sides of phone, and charging port. Did not receive the charging cable or wall piece and when I requested to just be refunded the price difference between a phone in excellent condition vs one in good condition I was offered $25 at best. I find it ridiculous that there is such a large price gap between the two phone conditions when the seller prices the items, but yet the seller doesn’t believe they are actually worth that when offering a refund for the difference. Poor customer service and a poor quality product. If you’re going to price the phone qualities so far apart at least offer the difference when you give someone a low quality product. I should’ve just requested a full refund instead of wasting my time thinking the company would just make it right by compensating for the difference. I won’t be buying from them because of principle. If they want to sell their merchandise for different prices based upon quality, they should also hold themselves to that standard when offering to make things right, instead of insulting their customers.

reviewTitle: This phone came disgusting and covered in grime and filth
reviewDescription: The buttons and the phone camera came covered in this goey black substance. It is inside of the buttons and under them, and it affects the way that they press down. I can’t get this stuff out of the cracks in between the buttons, and I am definitely returning this product because I am pretty sure that this will affect the phone in the future. The speakers also have dirt in them. I’m not sure that the sellers even cleaned this phone before they sent it, and the quality control is terrible. I am pretty sure this phone was dropped in a can of glue by the previous owner, and the fact that they accepted this and resold it still covered in disgusting grime shows that these people have NO QUALITY CONTROL whatsoever. I’ve bought products from Amazon renewed before and they always came clean and completely functional, but ever since then they have dropped in quality greatly. The AirPod pros that I bought a few months ago from Amazon renewed came broken in the box and they were linked to somebody else’s account, and this phone is so visually disgusting I don’t even know how it passed quality control. It’s very possible that amazon renewed just takes returned products, wipes them with a tissue and then resells them for a markup. I will not buy anything from them ever again.

Bought two phones back in May— one for my husband, and one for myself. They both worked well initially, but were VERY scratched up. Regardless, we didn’t really care as they worked well. It is now the end of August, and the batteries on both phones barely last a few hours. Very disappointing.

reviewTitle: BUYER BEWARE - Not compatible with advertised carriers.
reviewDescription: Update. The sellers are refusing to fix the issue of the phone not being compatible with US Cellular. It is unlocked, but the model number of the phone they sent does not have an antenna that is compatible with my carrier’s network. The claims that the phone will work with any network is FALSE, and the seller will not resolve.Overall the phone is in good shape. When I tried to get a SIM card to connect it to our family cell plan, we discovered that it was not compatible, even though the description included our cell carrier in the list of compatible carriers. Hopefully the sellers and Amazon will make it right.

Off experience ordered this phone and looked great after I turned service on the phone call on the speaker by the ear is not working. Just the one on the bottom really terrible unnecessary and frustrating. I hope you seller contact me to resolve this issue as soon as possible.

reviewTitle: Do not buy!  Poor quality.  Difficult returns!
reviewDescription: I purchased two of these phones, and spent extra for the “Premium Refurbished.”  Very disappointed as both phones had scratches and visual blemishes.  These should have been sold as the standard renewed items.  Also, the return process requires UPS to pick up the item while someone is home.  No option to simply return to a UPS location!  Customer service unable to offer a different return process.  So while I am on vacation UPS will be at my house 3 times to attempt pickup but will be unable to do so.  What a waste of time and resources!

We received the phone and it had issues in the beginning but my daughter did not want to take the time to return it and be without a phone for a minor inconvenience. After 3 months the screen completely stopped working. We took it to Apple and they said the parts it was refurbished with were not Apple and they could not fix it. Cheap parts were used the screen completely stopped working.
Phone was delivered in the wrong color, I ordered the blue... I'm fine with the dent and knicks.. but this phone "was guaranteed to have a minimum battery capacity of 80%" and it does not have that.

reviewTitle: Crappy deal on a crappy phone
reviewDescription: I bought this thinking it would be a similar refurbished product to others I’ve had before but it was in bad condition. They promised 80 percent battery life, but the phone had a warning right when I set it up that the battery was critically compromised and was below 80% health. The phone came in a dirty bag and wasn’t even cleaned. Scuffs on the frame, scratches on the screen. Nothing that would prevent you from using it but really disappointing to take a product out of the box and see it looking like it’s not been cleaned or “renewed” in any way. I will be returning it and I suggest no one else buy these.
It started with 96% within a week it went down to 86%. It doesn’t last more that 4-5 hours of batter life.  Phone works but it’s not Apple battery it was replace with imitation battery.

Quickly after buying the phone, lots of issues started to pop up. The location wouldn’t work and it would lose reception at certain times. Then, just after the “return window”, the battery started dying with 20% left in the phone. Then it started dying with 70% left in the phone, and now it is completely not working anymore. Feel like I have been scammed.

The description said “refurbished to excellent”. The battery doesn’t hold a charge, the phone doesn’t work because it overheats!!!! The reason for this purchase is because my phone broke. Now I’m being told I have to send it back for anything to be done. Therefore, I’m phoneless until I receive the new phone!? Never purchasing from this seller again.

reviewTitle: Even after battery replacement - product still doesn’t hold charge/gets very hot
reviewDescription: Unfortunately even after replacing the battery, this phone still does not hold a charge and gets very hot when charging. I’m really bummed I spent money on this product and the repairs :(!If the seller can do anything to correct this, please don’t hesitate to reach out - I’ll correct my review if this gets resolved.

I bought this iPhone in April 2024. Suddenly, at beginning of July bright bands of light appeared on the face of the phone. Apple did a diagnostic and found that the battery was bad. Do not deal with this 3rd party company. It’s been an endless hassle to resolve this and get a decent iPhone through my carrier.

Definitely not what I expected for the price, I paid a little more for an iphone in better condition and it was not.The iphone comes with so many scratches and bumps on its 4 sides, the cameras equally scratched, the battery at 86%.It was a very bad purchase and the worst thing is that I am outside the USA and I can not return it, I would ask for the money back if possible and I would not buy it again.

I got a 100% battery really love it, i thought it gonna be so good BUT the battery dies very quickly plus it’s really hot even i didnt do nothing with it? AND its not detecting my SIM, ive tried it on the other phone and it worked i mean the SIM. Really really disappointed!!! Seller: MCEsales

The phone was in good physical condition but don't let that fool you. After spending multiple hours getting the phone set up off an iCloud save, the very first call I made immediately made me realize I was sent a complete dud. The microphone did not work despite various attempts at troubleshooting. BEWARE: Many early iPhone 12 and 12 Pro models had a faulty chip that would cause the microphone to not work. Shame on this seller for claiming that they tested and refurbished their products when the very basic function of making a PHONE CALL on a CELLULAR PHONE does not even work.Only buy from this seller if you're willing to go through a multi-week headache of trying to obtain a functioning phone. You will not get it from them, if my experience means anything.

The phone arrived and you couldnt talk on it without it being on speaker. still my 11 year old wanted to keep it because it was her first phone now here we are 5 months later and the screen goes green. Im highly disappointed.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for.
reviewDescription: I will not spend over $1000 on a damn phone. This is an alternative I can live with but it still seems ridiculous.

reviewTitle: Great looking phone but stopped working
reviewDescription: Got this phone and looks great however after a month it stopped working. You can no longer hear calls unless it on speaker.

I purchased the phone "renewed" and as the listing stated in "excellent" condition. The phone I received is in anything but renewed/excellent condition. Take a look at the attached pictures. The phone body is chipped all over the place with a nice dent in the top right corner. The front glass was tacky (some kind of residue build up) and covered in scratches. Either the previous owner didn't use a screen protector or the glass was reconditioned with sandpaper. I charged the phone and went immediately to the battery health indicator . Eighty six percent is not what I'd call "excellent"condition. I'm very disappointed in the quality of the phone I received. Against my better judgement, I'm keeping the phone thanks to the ninety day warranty. I was able to clean the phone up and it doesn't look half bad now in it's new case and glass screen protector (last pic). The phone is fully functional and seems to perform well enough.  However, if I purchase another reconditioned iPhone, it will likely be from Black Market or Swappa. Stay away from Amazon "renewed".

When compared to a Samsung,  at about the same price with fingerprint recognition and FAR superior photo quality(!!!), It was a no-brainer! This 12 is going back ASAP!!!!

reviewTitle: Some minor damage near the charging port and stratches around the camera.
reviewDescription: The phone came on time. But with minor stratches around the camera, and on the charging port. Works okay but didn't like how it came non excellent.
The “refurbished- excellent” iPhone that I purchased came with a battery of 83% capacity. For a renewed phone in excellent condition, you would expect a battery with better capacity than that.

Pricing lower than Swappa or Backmarket, with Amazon's return policy another plus.  Shipping delayed a few days, then delivered to an Amazon "hub" rather than my home.  I never had anything delivered elsewhere, but maybe that's a new option and I missed it when ordering.  Packed in a nice 'Amazon renewed' box that held contents securely, but that box was then just tossed into a much larger generic Amazon box for shipping--no padding, no airbags, etc.  Flimsy generic lightning cable included, along with a generic and obviously well used 5w charger (these accessories match what the listing indicated, so no problem).  Phone is in generally good cosmetic condition--back and sides seem very good, so was probably in a case; screen though has two distinct scratches toward the bottom.  Both are about a half inch long and both are visible at arm's length.  The plastic protective sticky sheet over the screen was fine, but the one over the camera lens was too sticky and left residue on the lens that I am unable to get off totally.  Phone booted up fine, and Battery Health & Charging in settings says the battery is at 92%.  However, the Battery Stats shortcut which pulls info from Apple Analytics has more accurate and detailed info.  It shows the phone has gone through 320 complete charging cycles and the actual capacity is currently 88.9%.  This is slightly below the 90% battery life that Renewed Premium is supposed to have.  Overall, with the screen scratches, sticky residue and slightly below advertised battery life, I'd give this iPhone 12 about a 7 out of 10.  If I can resolve the camera lens residue, it'd be an 8 or 8.5.  If I can't find a way to safely get the sticky residue off the camera lens, I'll have to return the phone.  :-)

reviewTitle: Excellent condition with good enough battery health
reviewDescription: [My review contains 6 photos][My review rating actually is 4.5 stars.]My interest in purchasing an Amazon Renewed iPhone 12 (2020) arose from favorable past experiences with renewed (used) purchases, and a more affordable opportunity to upgrade a first gen iPhone SE (2016).My order was placed on March 31, 2023, and it arrived on May 4, 2023.The unboxing experience was excellent. An unadorned white cardboard box labeled "Amazon Renewed" on the top and some device info on the back. Inside, side-by-side, two recessed trays, one for the iPhone (covered by a clear plastic film) and the second for a USB 5V power adapter and 3' Lightning cable. A "OPEN ME FIRST" sleeve with several cards inside: HI THERE, WE'VE GOT YOU COVERED, QUICK START GUIDE, SIM REMOVAL TOOL, and INSPECTION TEST CERTIFICATE.Cosmetically the phone looked brand new. No noticeable blemishes (just a tiny scratch near the Lightning connection).So, after powering on and setting up the iPhone 12, I checked a few things. WiFi and Bluetooth were okay. Face ID okay. The battery was at 81% charge, with a Max Capacity (Battery Health) of 89%.  iOS was at version 16.3.1, which I upgraded to 16.4.1, then 16.4.1(a).The back of the box noted "BH 91%" and the Inspection Certificate noted that "Your Device" – A2172 BH91 – was "Tested in New Jersey" on 03/24/2023" and "Battery Health 90%+ confirmed." So, in the time (~6 weeks) between inspection and arrival, this iPhone lost 2% of max battery capacity. Is this typical (as in other reviews)? Is this a big deal?Well, in my case 89% BH probably is good enough. The renewed iPhone 12 is not my primary smartphone. And the fully charged battery lasts longer than my old iPhone SE's. And the 12 has the latest iOS and other more recent hardware and software features (like MagSafe, Precision Finding).The Amazon Renewed Guarantee includes replacement or refund within 1 year of replacement. That's a plus.

But what bothers me most is that new screen protectors don’t adhere properly to this phone. There are always air bubbles under my screen protector. It drives me nuts because it looks messy.

My iPhone SE 2nd gen very suddenly bit the dust after 3 years and I needed a new device FAST! I didn’t want to drop close to $1K on a new phone but still wanted to upgrade from my much older previous phone.  My iPhone 12 arrived within a few business days. My only complaints are that the third party charger that was sent along did not work, but thankfully I already had several iPhone compatible chargers in my home. The battery health is at 80% but I expected about that much as it is a used device. So far a full charge with moderate use (listening to music, checking social media and texts) lasts me a whole workday anyways. Besides, even getting a new battery eventually would still be a lot cheaper than buying new from Apple and I felt really confident in Amazon to give me a refund in the event the phone was not in working order. Thankfully, everything functions fantastic! I ordered a T-mobile locked one and then just swapped over my SIM, and it updated on my plan immediately to reflect the new phone. Overall I would absolutely buy from Amazon renewed again!

So, the phone itself is a 5/5⭐️ review. Everything seems to be working great. Storage is great. I had a iPhone XS with 64g of memory. With all the apps I want loaded onto it I’ve filled 25g. My pictures took up a lot of space so I’m happy that I have the room for more. The phone came with a charger which was great for me as I break mine a lot.Now, the reason I gave it a 4/5⭐️ is due to the shipping aspect. I do understand this is out of the sellers control. I ended up finding it at a neighbors house looking all creepy like. They walked out and began yelling at me till they saw it was mine.

I Like the phone, but the scratches kind of bother me. It’s honestly fine tho I’m kinda sad the battery service was at 80 but it’s okay, it’s a decent phone the display is so good compared to the 11 it’s way more vibrant, shipping was quick and I do not regret getting this phone.

I bought an “excellent condition” iPhone 12 64gb. The screen and back of the phone were mint and there was one small chip on the border where it was clearly dropped. This didn’t impact the screen or function of the phone in any noticeable way though. The battery health was 90%.
